Deze multimediatour is ontwikkeld door Fabrique [merken, design & interactie] en Frankly, Green and Webb in opdracht van het Van Gogh Museum. Alle informatie, teksten, afbeeldingen en geluidsfragmenten zijn auteursrechtelijk beschermd en mogen niet worden gereproduceerd zonder voorafgaande toestemming van het Van Gogh Museum.

De schilderijen, tekeningen en brieven komen uit de collectie van het Van Gogh Museum (Vincent van Gogh Stichting), met uitzondering van:

This multimedia guide has been produced by Fabrique [brands, design & interaction] and Frankly, Green and Webb on behalf of the Van Gogh Museum. All the information, texts, images and audio clips are protected by copyright and may not be reproduced without the prior consent of the Van Gogh Museum.

The paintings, drawings and letters come from the collection of the Van Gogh Museum (Vincent van Gogh Foundation), with the exception of:

Explore at leisure and See the highlights

Stop 18

Louis-Emile Durandelle, Square Saint-Pierre, Bibliothèque Nationale de France, Paris

Stop 21

Ch. Karsenty, Zouave soldier, Courtesy Wolfgang Wiggers

Stop 24

Postcard, General view taken from Trinquetaille, private collection

Stop 37

Jean-François Millet, Woman Carding Wool, on loan from Stedelijk Museum Amsterdam

Stop 37

Auguste Boulard, The Meal, on loan from Rijksmuseum Amsterdam

Stop 40

Stop 41

Picture of the atelier of Cormon, Musée Toulouse-Lautrec, Albi

Stop 53

Vincent van Gogh, Van Gogh’s Chair, The National Gallery, London

Stop 55

Stop 76

Visitor information

Opening hours 2017

2 January - 8 January 2017: 
9 am to 7 pm, Friday until 10 pm, Saturday until 9 pm

27 March - 13 July 2017:
9 am to 6 pm, Fridays until 10 pm

14 July - 3 September 2017: 
9 am to 7 pm, Fridays until 10 pm, Saturdays until 9 pm

4 September - 5 November 2017:
9 am to 6 pm, Fridays until 10 pm

25 December 2017 - 7 January 2018: 
9 am to 6 pm, Fridays until 10 pm. New Year's Day (1 January 2018): open from 11 am

All other days: 
9 am to 5 pm, Fridays until 10 pm
